planets.name: Mercury
planets.description: The smallest planet in our solar system and closest to the Sun. It has extreme temperatures and no atmosphere.

planets.name: Venus
planets.description: Venus has a thick, toxic atmosphere and is the hottest planet due to its runaway greenhouse effect.

planets.name: Earth
planets.description: The only planet known to support life, Earth has a diverse climate and a protective atmosphere. Our home planet is the third planet from the Sun, and the fifth largest planet.

planets.name: Mars
planets.description: Known as the Red Planet, Mars has the largest volcano in the solar system and signs of ancient water.

planets.name: Jupiter
planets.description: The largest planet, Jupiter has a Great Red Spot—a giant storm—and dozens of moons.

planets.name: Saturn
planets.description: Famous for its stunning ring system, Saturn is a gas giant with more than 80 moons.

planets.name: Uranus
planets.description: An ice giant with a unique sideways rotation, Uranus has a faint ring system.

planets.name: Neptune
planets.description: The windiest planet, Neptune has a deep blue color and a large storm called the Great Dark Spot.

dwarfPlanets.name: Pluto
dwarfPlanets.description: Once considered the ninth planet, Pluto is now classified as a dwarf planet in the Kuiper Belt.

dwarfPlanets.name: Ceres
dwarfPlanets.description: The largest object in the asteroid belt, Ceres is the only dwarf planet in the inner solar system.

dwarfPlanets.name: Eris
dwarfPlanets.description: Slightly smaller than Pluto, Eris caused the reclassification of planets due to its discovery.

dwarfPlanets.name: Haumea
dwarfPlanets.description: An oddly shaped dwarf planet with a rapid rotation, located in the Kuiper Belt.

dwarfPlanets.name: Makemake
dwarfPlanets.description: A bright dwarf planet in the Kuiper Belt, Makemake has a reddish color similar to Pluto.
